HTML:
Job Description

As the largest aggregator of structured risk information and property data in Canada, Opta Information Intelligence is a leading provider of property intelligence and innovative technology solutions. Combined with proprietary technology, Opta helps clients access, understand, and synthesize previously inaccessible information, turning it into intelligence that helps to discover and understand business risks. Opta initially began as the Canadian Fire Underwriters’ Association (CFUA) in 1883.

The Fire Underwriter’s Survey (FUS) is a division of Opta. FUS was established as part of the Canadian Fire Underwriters’ Association (CFUA) in 1883. The group of engineers, technologists and analysts have evaluated and aggregated data on public fire protection infrastructure since its establishment. FUS uses GIS technology to maintain this dataset called the Grading Index. Further information can be found at www.fireunderwriters.ca.

  • Reporting to the Director, Engineering Technology & FUS (Fire Underwriters Survey), the incumbent will utilize their technical expertise to provide innovative solutions for continuous product improvement while supporting FUS in the development of the changes.
  • The incumbent will be a subject matter expert for specific FUS and Municipal Consulting products, including but not limited to, fire insurance grades, management science (emergency resource deployment) and GIS spatial analytics. The incumbent will be responsible for conducting research and analysis and documenting business process improvement opportunities and/or business requirements.
  • Key responsibilities of this role are analysis and solution definition, technical recommendation, testing and project execution. The incumbent will proactively identify and recommend opportunities for improvement and implement change. The incumbent will be required to acquire the knowledge, expertise and understanding of Opta services in order for successfully completion of projects. The incumbent will work closely with FUS and IT ensuring all changes are effectively implemented and aligned with the operations team’s business plan.

Responsibilities

  • Develop methodology and architecture for fire insurance grade maps by maintaining and developing the system for various GIS
  • Develop, plan and implement GIS applications software for the system users and operators.
  • Design and develop GIS database models and templates.
  • Integrates GIS elements with other technology for marketing and web-based communications
  • Respond to difficult inquiries from end-users, developers and customers
  • Assist in analyzing, testing and resolving production problems
  • Assists in writing procedures for utilizing GIS software and applications
  • Produce fire insurance grade maps by utilizing best available data, determine application areas of fire insurance grades to be used by insurers across Canada.
  • Develop and analyze data for municipal consultants, produce maps to support municipal level decision making around deployment of emergency services for fire, ambulance and police. Identify and recommend opportunities for improvement and implement change.
  • Assist Business Unit Leader in developing tactical and strategic product, services and/or programs to support the business unit goals.
  • Analyze the business unit activities and trends and compare analysis against the service standards and best practices. Present findings and work with the Business Unit Leader and other personnel to identify and implement strategies that will address tactical and strategic goals.
  • Become a subject matter expert on specific FUS and Municipal Consulting products, including but not limited to, fire insurance grades, management science (emergency resource deployment) and GIS spatial analytics. Work with development and business personnel to develop and execute plans to test and validate systems/applications and business requirements, including developing user documentation, first draft of training materials, manual updates, and field communications

Qualifications

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, GIS or related field
  • 5 years' experience using ArcGIS Desktop (ArcMap and ArcCatalog) and ArcGIS Pro.
  • 3 years' experience working with ArcGIS Server.
  • 3 years' experience using Python scripts and Arcpy.
  • Post-graduate degree in GIS would be an asset
  • Excellent understanding in the areas of: GIS programming (including python/R and other languages); GIS database design.
  • Understands various geospatial data types and coordinate systems.
  • Strong knowledge of ESRI ArcGIS and Analyst extension.
  • Project Management skills and demonstrated ability to deliver results.
  • Business writing skills that focus on clear and concise communications.
  • Ability to deliver high quality work under pressure.
  • Proven ability to positively interact with all levels within the organization.
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office and excellent computer skills
  • Knowledge of Canadian governance architecture (at all levels) an asset

About Us

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Title: AI Agent Engineer
Description:
AI Agent Engineer | naptha.ai

About The Role

We are seeking an AI Agent Engineer to join our team at Naptha AI, where you'll help build and test AI agents using our interoperability platform. This role is perfect for developers who are passionate about AI and eager to gain hands-on experience with the latest agent frameworks and large language models.

Core Responsibilities


Build and deploy AI agents using various frameworks
Test agent interactions and document behavior
Help improve agent performance and reliability
Assist with agent integration and testing
Contribute to our growing agent ecosystem


Required Experience


Strong Python programming skills
Experience working with LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.)
Basic understanding of AI concepts
Ability to write clear documentation
Enthusiasm for AI and emerging technology


Nice to have


Familiarity with agent frameworks (LangChain, AutoGPT, etc.)
Basic DevOps knowledge
Experience with API development
Open source contributions


About The Hiring Process


Initial technical screen
Coding exercise
Team interview
Final discussion


Compensation & Benefits


Competitive salary and equity
Remote-first work environment
Full medical coverage
Flexible PTO
Learning budget


Join us in building the future of AI agent interoperability! This is an excellent opportunity to grow your skills in a rapidly evolving field.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join the Future of Blockchain Data Science! 🚀




Seeking a Data Scientist with expertise in blockchain analytics, DeFi applications, and financial forensics.




📍 Location: Vancouver, BC (Local candidates preferred)

📆 Experience: 4+ years of professional experience




Are you passionate about uncovering insights from blockchain data and optimizing financial models for decentralized applications? Our client, a leading innovator in the blockchain ecosystem, is seeking a Data Scientist to drive data-driven decision-making and enhance real-time analytics.




🔥 Why Join Us?




We are revolutionizing blockchain data intelligence, providing cutting-edge analytics for traders, analysts, and blockchain enthusiasts. As a Data Scientist, you’ll work at the intersection of blockchain technology, machine learning, and quantitative finance to develop innovative solutions for on-chain analytics, risk assessment, and predictive modeling.




💡 What You’ll Do:

• Analyze and interpret complex blockchain datasets, with a focus on Solana and DeFi applications

• Build models for financial forensics, fraud detection, and user behavior analysis

• Design and implement predictive analytics and segmentation models

• Optimize big data pipelines and ensure efficient data processing at scale

• Utilize Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Seaborn, Plotly) to present insights

• Work with AI-powered automation tools, integrating GPT-based services to streamline workflows

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making




🎯 Your Impact:




Your expertise in blockchain analytics and quantitative finance will shape real-time data insights for the Web3 ecosystem. You’ll play a pivotal role in detecting patterns, mitigating risks, and improving DeFi applications through advanced statistical modeling and AI-driven solutions.




💰 The Perks:

✅ Work with cutting-edge blockchain technology

✅ Be part of a fast-growing Web3 analytics company

✅ Career growth in data science, blockchain, and AI

✅ Flexible, collaborative work environment

✅ Flexible work from home environment




🚀 Ready to transform blockchain data into actionable insights? Apply now! Contact Callum Farrell at callum.farrell@kerrysp.com to learn more about this exciting opportunity.

Title: Data Collector -Regional Health Survey
Place: Metro Vancouver A, British Columbia, Canada
Description:
About Us

FNHA Overview

The First Nations Health Authority is a diverse and transformational health organization of professional, innovative, and dedicated team members and leaders.

The first of its kind in Canada, FNHA works as a health-and-wellness partner with BC First Nations to support self-determination and decision-making to improve health outcomes.

FNHA is proud to have been named one of BC’s Top Employers for 2025. Learn more about why we were selected here.

The First Nations Regional Health Survey (RHS) is the only First Nations -governed, national health survey in Canada. It collects information about on-reserve and northern First Nations communities based on both Western and traditional understandings of health and well-being. This survey will be conducted primarily online and by telephone.

Title: Data Collector - Regional Health Survey (Multiple Positions)

Salary: $19.38 - $23.12 - $25.44 per hour (pay range explained below)

Contract: Term until March 31, 2025

Hours: Part-time - 18.75 hours per week

Location: Vancouver/Fraser Salish locations

About The Role

As the Data Collector, you will implement the RHS by engaging participants living in community and collecting data according to the methods requested by community leadership. In this role, you will make initial contact with participant to discuss the survey and the participant’s role, ensure that participants provide informed consent prior to survey completion, schedule an appointment with the participant for telephone survey completion, conduct confidential data collection activities using a laptop computer, ensure that all data captured is kept secure at all times and that confidentiality of all data collected and names of participants is maintained. Travel to First Nation communities upon request.

About You

To be successful in this role you will have:


Valid British Columbia driver’s license
Must attend virtual training sessions prior to data collection
Knowledge of and respect for BC First Nations history and diverse cultures
Must be available to work days, evenings and weekends. Hours are subject to change depending upon operational requirements
Must know how to speak, read and write English, have effective interpersonal skills, be at least 19 years of age, and complete and pass a criminal record check
Ability to navigate multiple electronic devices and programs; to work independently, and as part of a team, with minimal supervision; and to handle sensitive and confidential information and matters in a trusted and responsible manner
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position
Basic skills including use of spreadsheets and word processing preferred
Access to a personal vehicle an asset
Experience working with First Nations is an asset
Data collection experience in a survey project is an asset
Knowledge of OCAP® principles an asset
Please refer to Job Specification section of the Job Description for more details.


Working at FNHA

Benefits

As a member of the team, you will have access to a wide range of employee benefits from day one, including:


San 'Yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training
Access to LinkedIn learning
Mindful Mondays
And more!


The First Nations Health Authority is committed to respecting diversity within our workforce; preference will be given to individuals who identify as First Nations, Inuit, or Métis.

Leading with culture, all FNHA employees complete San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training. We support our family to be leaders in wellness and all staff members develop a yearly wellness plan as part of their performance partnership and goal-setting.

The Pay Range is the minimum and maximum annual salary based on full time equivalent hours. Incumbents are typically hired, transferred or promoted between the minimum and midpoint of the range based on their knowledge, skills, abilities and experience in relation to the role requirements. The top 10% of the pay range is for the incumbents who are industry experts in the job with the combination of exceptional experience and competencies needed to perform all duties and responsibilities at a superior capability level. Internal employee compensation will be determined as per the FNHA Employee Total Compensation Policy

How To Apply

If this sound likes the opportunity for you, please click on the 'Apply for Job' button.

Closing date: Open Until Filled

For more information about us, please visit: http://www.fnha.ca/about/work-with-us

For information about Cultural Safety and Humility (fnha.ca) and for information about Land Acknowledgements

If you have any inquiries or issues please contact FNHA Recruitment at careers@fnha.ca

Follow us at: Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Instagram
Show more

Title: Senior Business Advisor (Analytics)
Description:
Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for driving operational excellence? Join our Enterprise Data Strategy & Services team as a Senior Business Advisor, where you'll play a critical role in shaping the future of our organization.

In this role, you will provide confidential advice and guidance to senior management on key operations and strategic initiatives, leveraging your expertise in data, algorithms, and experimental design to support system implementations of embedded analytics, tools and processes. Your insights will not only influence decision-making and problem-solving but also identify opportunities to increase operational effectiveness across the board. You'll also make a significant impact and help the organization navigate the complexities of business process change.

How you'll make a difference: You'll drive improvements to data, measurement, and impact assessment processes that will improve our organization's ability to maximize the benefits we create for the workers and employers of B.C.

Where you'll work

At WorkSafeBC, we offer a model that combines the convenience of working remotely with the dynamism of working in one of our offices, based on the operational needs of the position.

In this role, you'll work primarily from our Richmond office, with some flexibility to work from your home in B.C.


Support the integration of embedded analytics, machine learning models, and advanced algorithms into decision-making processes.
Lead process and change management initiatives to drive adoption of predictive, prescriptive, and optimization algorithms.
Advise leadership on data, measurement, and experimentation-related business process improvement initiatives, including research into the implementation and its impacts.
Facilitate strategic business planning discussions and provide guidance on implementing strategic objectives.
Evaluate business improvement options, project viability, and economic implications through business case analysis and feasibility assessments.
Conduct comprehensive program reviews to identify operational efficiencies, financial inefficiencies, and opportunities for optimization and automation, with a core focus on improving key data, measurement, and experimentation-related processes, outputs, and outcomes.


We're Looking For People Who Can


Leverage AI, machine learning, and statistical modeling to drive innovation and process optimization.
Implement experimentation frameworks to validate and optimize machine learning algorithms.
Communicate and present complex ideas clearly and effectively to diverse audiences, including senior management.
Work effectively with cross-functional teams and build productive relationships by leveraging a consultative approach.
Use data-driven insights to identify challenges and opportunities.
Navigate change with flexibility and resilience in a dynamic environment.
Evaluate situations carefully and make informed decisions on critical organization wide initiatives.
Lead and support cross-functional teams with project related activities.


Your background and experience


A master's degree or designation in a related field.
A minimum of three years of related experience including experience in:
analytical and root cause analysis
strategy development
performance measurement
Experimental design and execution experience
Process design and related change management experience
Experience with AI-driven decision support systems and predictive analytics is highly desirable.
Algorithm deployment and MLOps experience is highly desirable.
Consulting experience is highly desirable.


We'll consider equivalent combinations of education and experience.

Important to know

Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must:


Consent to a criminal record check
Confirm you're legally entitled to work in Canada


Who we are

At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We're honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province.

What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It's challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for.

Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflect the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.

Learn more: Discover who we are .

Our Benefits

As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work — and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes:


Defined benefit pension plan that provides you with a lifetime monthly pension when you retire
4 weeks of vacation in your first year, with regular increases based on years of service
Benefits package that includes customizable options for health care and dental benefits, additional days off, and a health care spending account
Optional leave arrangements
Development opportunities (tuition reimbursement, leadership development, and more)


Learn more: Find out what we offer .

Salary: $116,186 - $141,166 annually

Want to apply?


Applications are welcomed immediately; however, they must be received no later than 4:30 p.m. PST on the closing date.
Please note that we will be starting assessments before the closing date.


We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require accommodation during the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.
Show more

  • Communicate and present complex ideas clearly and effectively to diverse audiences, including senior management.
  • Work effectively with cross-functional teams and build productive relationships by leveraging a consultative approach.
  • Use data-driven insights to identify challenges and opportunities.
  • Navigate change with flexibility and resilience in a dynamic environment.
  • Evaluate situations carefully and make informed decisions on critical organization wide initiatives.
  • Lead and support cross-functional teams with project related activities.

Your background and experience

  • A master's degree or designation in a related field.
  • A minimum of three years of related experience including experience in:
  • analytical and root cause analysis
  • strategy development
  • performance measurement
  • Experimental design and execution experience
  • Process design and related change management experience
  • Experience with AI-driven decision support systems and predictive analytics is highly desirable.
  • Algorithm deployment and MLOps experience is highly desirable.
  • Consulting experience is highly desirable.

We'll consider equivalent combinations of education and experience.

Important to know

Before we can finalize any offer of employment, you must:

  • Consent to a criminal record check
  • Confirm you're legally entitled to work in Canada

Who we are

At WorkSafeBC, we promote safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries or diseases occur, we provide compensation and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We're honoured to serve the 2.49 million workers and 263,000 registered employers in our province.

What's it like to work at WorkSafeBC?

It's challenging, stimulating, and rewarding. Our positions offer diversity and opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important, and so are the people we do it for.

Our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences that reflect the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self.

Learn more: Discover who we are .

Our Benefits

As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that help you get the most out of work — and life. Along with a competitive salary, your total compensation package includes:

  • Defined benefit pension plan that provides you with a lifetime monthly pension when you retire
  • 4 weeks of vacation in your first year, with regular increases based on years of service
  • Benefits package that includes customizable options for health care and dental benefits, additional days off, and a health care spending account
  • Optional leave arrangements
  • Development opportunities (tuition reimbursement, leadership development, and more)

Learn more: Find out what we offer .

Salary: $116,186 - $141,166 annually

Want to apply?

  • Applications are welcomed immediately; however, they must be received no later than 4:30 p.m. PST on the closing date.
  • Please note that we will be starting assessments before the closing date.

We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require accommodation during the assessment process, please email Recruitment Testing Accommodation (SM) when you submit your application.

Title: Backbase
Description:
Offre d'Emploi : Analyste Fonctionnel (AF), QA et Développeur Backbase

Lieu : Vancouver à distance

Type de contrat : 12 mois

Salaire :

Date de début : Dès que possible

Description de l'entreprise :

Nous sommes une entreprise spécialisée dans la transformation numérique et l'intégration de solutions bancaires. Dans le cadre de notre expansion, nous recherchons plusieurs profils pour renforcer notre équipe d'experts Backbase : Analystes Fonctionnels (AF), QA et Développeurs. Vous rejoindrez une équipe dynamique et passionnée par l'innovation. Profil recherché : 2. QA Backbase (Testeur)


Analyste Fonctionnel (AF) Backbase Responsabilités :
Recueillir et analyser les besoins fonctionnels des clients.
Rédiger des spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées.
Assurer le lien entre les équipes techniques et les équipes métiers.
Participer à la conception de la solution Backbase en fonction des exigences clients.
Suivre l’avancement du projet et effectuer des revues fonctionnelles.
Accompagner le client tout au long du projet, du recueil des besoins au déploiement.
Expérience d’au moins 3 ans en analyse fonctionnelle, de préférence sur des projets Backbase.
Bonne compréhension des processus métiers dans le secteur bancaire.
Capacité à rédiger des spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées.
Excellentes compétences en communication.


Responsabilités :


Élaborer et exécuter les tests fonctionnels et techniques pour valider la plateforme Backbase.
Participer à la création de plans de tests détaillés en fonction des exigences fonctionnelles.
Identifier, documenter et suivre les défauts et les problèmes jusqu’à leur résolution.
Automatiser les tests fonctionnels et effectuer des tests de régression.
Travailler étroitement avec les équipes de développement pour assurer la qualité du produit.


Profil recherché :


Expérience de 2 à 4 ans en qualité logicielle, de préférence sur des projets Backbase.
Solides compétences en automatisation des tests et utilisation d'outils comme Selenium, JUnit, etc.
Connaissance des bonnes pratiques de test dans le cadre de projets Backbase.
Bonne maîtrise de l’anglais et du français, à l’oral et à l’écrit.


3. Développeur Backbase

Responsabilités :


Développer, implémenter et maintenir des solutions Backbase.
Concevoir des composants personnalisés en utilisant les technologies web (Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS).
Collaborer avec les équipes fonctionnelles et QA pour garantir l’alignement technique et fonctionnel des solutions.
Assurer l’intégration avec d’autres systèmes bancaires existants.
Suivre les bonnes pratiques de développement et assurer la qualité du code.


Profil recherché :


Expérience de 3 à 5 ans en développement sur la plateforme Backbase.
Solide expertise en Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, ainsi qu’en architecture des applications web.
Connaissance des bonnes pratiques de développement Backbase.
Esprit d’équipe et capacité à travailler en mode Agile.


Avantages :


Salaire compétitif avec avantages sociaux.
Télétravail et flexibilité des horaires.
Opportunités de développement professionnel et de formation.
Travailler dans une entreprise innovante et en pleine expansion.
Show more

Title: Senior Business System Analyst
Description:
Haventree Bank is a private Canadian Schedule 1 bank specializing in alternative mortgage programs and insured GIC deposits. We help hardworking Canadians from coast-to-coast achieve homeownership by offering flexible mortgage solutions. Our insured GIC deposits offer competitive rates and are available through a variety of wealth management platforms.

About Haventree Bank

Headquartered in Toronto, Ontario, Haventree Bank (Haventree) is a mission driven alternative mortgage lender. The name Haventree is representative of the bank’s mission to help its customers find a place of refuge and to lay down new roots for the future. Haventree exists to be a catalyst of financial security and upward mobility for Canadians who are underserved by the traditional financial system.

Qualifications & Experience

Major Duties & Responsibilities:


Lead the analysis and documentation of complex business processes and workflows.
Develop and document system specifications and functional requirements working closely with functional teams including product, design, risk, fraud amongst others.
Work closely with product and engineering team to design, test, and deploy new systems and enhancements.
Set up and manage system configurations of third-party platforms and solutions
Monitor system performance, troubleshooting issues, and ensure optimal system functionality


Degrees, Diplomas & Certifications


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.


Years and Range of Experience Required to Perform the Job:


3-5 years of strong experience as a Business Systems Analyst in financial services / fintech
Strong technical, documentation and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Start-up experience as an added plus
Show more

  • Start-up experience as an added plus

Title: Associate Software Developer (Co-op position)
Description:
HP Anyware invented the PCoIP remote display protocol and developed Engineering Emmy-Award-winning Anyware products to deliver the best virtual and remote desktop experience in the world.

Our exciting growth and continuing success mean that we are looking for an energetic co-op student (Engineering or Computer Science) to join our Software Development team. This is an exciting opportunity to participate in the development and testing of HP Anyware's software components for our HP Anyware family of products and to assist in modernizing our development and build environment. You will be joining a team that is building a microservices application running as a SaaS solution. As a Software Developer, you will be part of the development team in building a quality product and designing automated tests that will become part of the CI/CD pipeline of the product and enable high iterations and frequent releases with confidence.

Responsibilities


Development of software components related to Microservices-based solutions.
Building scalable, cost-effective test automation with a focus on API tests, product-level integration tests and end-to-end tests.
Integrating automated security scanning and testing into the CI/CD pipeline.
Contribute to integrating automated testing into the CI/CD pipeline.
Be an active member of a Scrum team and learn about agile software development.
Learn about the DevOps culture (development and operations of a SaaS solution).
Testing of developed components within a virtual desktop infrastructure.
Software development in NodeJS (TypeScript, JavaScript)
Software development for test automation in Python and Terraform.


Requirements


Students who have completed at least 2 academic years.
Students who love to program software (ideally before they join university) and have an interest in software services.
Students who have experience with cloud environments, such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform.
Individuals who work well with others, think outside the box and see raising the bar as part of the daily routine.


Other Information


Preference will be given to Co-op Students currently enrolled in an Undergraduate program.
Please upload a copy of your unofficial transcript with your application.
4-month work term
Start date: May 2025
Full-time with the possibility of extension and/or permanent career positions
The typical base pay range for this co-op role is $3,700 to 5,000 per month. Pay within this range will be based on the review of experience, skills and internal equity.


HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it’s just who we are. From the boardroom to the factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

HP Canada Co. is an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome the many dimensions of diversity. Upon request by qualified candidates, accommodation of special needs may be considered during all stages of the selection process within the framework of the HP Accommodation Policy. If you need assistance in filling outthe employment application or require a reasonable accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail hrgsglobalstaffing@hp.com. Note: This option is reserved for applicants needing a reasonable accommodation related to a disability.

In order to satisfy our contractual obligations with clients, the successful candidate will be required to pass a basic, standard Criminal Records check. You will also be required to sign off on HP's Confidentiality, Non-Solicitation and Conflict of Interest Agreement.

Title: Esri Developer
Description:
Fujitsu's organizational model includes several North American centers of excellence.

Geomatics is one of these in its own right.

The Geomatics Center of Excellence covers all Fujitsu's North American offices - a global offering, a local presence, and carries out projects around the world, largely from Quebec.

We bring several elements to the geomatics world that set it apart from other companies.

Fujitsu is currently looking for a Esri Developer to join its GIS practice.

Tasks

The Esri Developer is responsible for the development and support of a critical portfolio of Esri applications.


Be competent with full-stack, modern Web GIS application development
Provide efficient support for a portfolio of business applications
Be actively involved with the analysis, troubleshooting and resolution of incidents for applications and Esri technologies
Be able to effectively communicate with the client representatives in response to support issues or refinement of detailed enhancements
Be able to gain a good understanding of business workflows, application functionalities, change management and processes
Be able to manage multiple tasks involving support requests, application enhancements and scheduled maintenance duties
Effectively collaborate with team members to ensure successful deliveries
Must be fluent in English


Mandatory Requirements


JavaScript, ReactJS, Python
Esri ArcGIS API for JavaScript
Esri WebApp Builder
Esri Experience Builder
Esri ArcPy


Optional


.Net
SQL Server


We Offer


Local, personalized career guidance
An adapted training program
Work-life balance
The opportunity to work remotely in distributed, multicultural teams
Respect and equality
Note that Fujitsu also promotes the French language.


Benefits, What To Expect At Fujitsu


Vacation: 3 to 4 weeks depending on experience.
Retirement plan (RRSP) with employer contribution equivalent to up to 4% of your base salary per year.
Full group insurance from day 1
And many other benefits!


Our Diversity And Equity Policies

At Fujitsu, one of our corporate principles is "We respect human rights". This principle underpins all our corporate and individual activities and guides the actions of every member of the Fujitsu Group. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. By empowering people, we can unleash our collective strengths to create a better experience for our employees, customers and partners.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry


IT Services and IT Consulting


Employment Type: Full-time
Show more

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Salesforce Developer with expertise in Field Service Cloud to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Salesforce development and a passion for optimizing field service processes through innovative solutions. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing customized solutions within the Salesforce ecosystem to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our field service operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements related to Field Service Cloud functionalities.
Design and develop customized applications, workflows, and integrations within the Salesforce platform to improve field service management.
Implement and configure Field Service Cloud features, including work order management, scheduling, and dispatching.
Customize Salesforce objects, fields, page layouts, and record types to align with business processes.
Develop Apex classes, triggers, Visualforce pages, and Lightning components to extend Salesforce functionality.
Create and manage reports and dashboards to provide insights into field service operations and performance metrics.
Collaborate with the QA team to conduct unit testing and ensure the quality and reliability of developed solutions.
Stay up-to-date with Salesforce releases and best practices, particularly related to Field Service Cloud.
Provide ongoing support and maintenance for existing Salesforce applications and solutions.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Salesforce Developer, with a focus on Field Service Cloud.
Strong proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, and Salesforce APIs.
Experience with Salesforce Field Service features, including service scheduling, mobile app configuration, and work order management.
Familiarity with Salesforce administration tasks, such as user management, security settings, and data management.
Knowledge of integration tools and technologies (e.g., MuleSoft, REST/SOAP APIs) is a plus.
Salesforce certifications, particularly Salesforce Certified Developer and Salesforce Certified Field Service Consultant, are preferred.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Show more
